publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3935 Peter Peacock: Congratulations to Gordon and MacPhail—That the Parliament congratulates the Elgin-based and family-owned firm, Gordon and MacPhail, on winning a prestigious Queen’s Award for Enterprise: International Trade 2009, following a 94% increase in the value of its total exports over the last five years; notes that this local company, which began in 1895, employs 130 people in Elgin and Forres, stocks around 300 different whisky brands and currently exports around 60% of all its bottled products; further notes that the company has recently expanded its export department and plans to boost international sales, which last year amounted to around £3.6 million across 50 different markets; recognises the dedication and hard work of all the staff who have worked to make the company one of Scotland’s leading independent whisky specialists, and wishes Gordon and MacPhail every success for the future.

S3M-3935 Congratulations to Gordon and MacPhail (lodged on 21 April 2009) Hugh Henry*, David Stewart*, Sarah Boyack*, Rhoda Grant*, Des McNulty*, Gil Paterson*, John Park*, Jamie McGrigor*, Hugh O’Donnell*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Bill Kidd*, Marilyn Livingstone*, Bob Doris*
S3M-3935 Congratulations to Gordon and MacPhail (lodged on 21 April 2009) Mary Mulligan*, Jackie Baillie*, Trish Godman*, Dr Richard Simpson*

S3M-3935 Peter Peacock: Congratulations to Gordon and MacPhail—That the Parliament congratulates the Elgin-based and family-owned firm, Gordon and MacPhail, on winning a prestigious Queen’s Award for Enterprise: International Trade 2009 following a 94% increase in the value of its total exports over the last five years; notes that this local company, which began in 1895, employs 130 people in Elgin and Forres, stocks around 300 different whisky brands and currently exports around 60% of all its bottled products; further notes that the company has recently expanded its export department and plans to boost international sales, which last year amounted to around £3.6 million across 50 different markets; recognises the dedication and hard work of all the staff who have worked to make the company one of Scotland’s leading independent whisky specialists, and wishes Gordon and MacPhail every success for the future. Supported by: Hugh Henry, David Stewart, Sarah Boyack, Rhoda Grant, Des McNulty, Gil Paterson, John Park, Jamie McGrigor, Hugh O’Donnell, Mr Frank McAveety, Bill Kidd, Marilyn Livingstone, Bob Doris, Mary Mulligan, Jackie Baillie, Trish Godman, Dr Richard Simpson
S3M-3935 Congratulations to Gordon and MacPhail (lodged on 21 April 2009) Stuart McMillan*
S3M-3935 Congratulations to Gordon and MacPhail (lodged on 21 April 2009) Karen Whitefield*
S3M-3935 Congratulations to Gordon and MacPhail (lodged on 21 April 2009) Mary Scanlon*
